algorithm_technique: Find the median of the array and sum the absolute differences to it.
Use Quickselect to find the median efficiently.
problem_summary_simple: Find the minimum moves to make all array elements equal by incrementing or decrementing any element by 1.
problem_summary_technical: The optimal target value is the median of the array. Calculate the sum of absolute differences between each element and the median.
time_complexity: O(n log n) for sorting-based median, O(n) on average for Quickselect
space_complexity: O(1) if sorting in-place or O(n) for sorting if not in-place
key_insights: The problem is to minimize the sum of absolute differences, which is achieved by choosing the median as the target value.
Sorting the array allows easy identification of the median.
Quickselect provides an average O(n) solution for finding the median, which is more efficient for large arrays.
The median minimizes the sum of absolute deviations.
Quickselect algorithm efficiently finds the k-th smallest element (median in this case).
The partitioning step in Quickselect is crucial for its average O(n) performance.
